repnme.cdata!:
A fiscal turnaround in Brazil’s state of
            Rio Grande do Sul

abstracts.cdata!:
This Result Profile tells us about a
            fiscal turnaround in Brazil's state of Rio Grande do
            Sul. It had a long history of fiscal mismanagement.
            Excessive expenditures and generosity in granting tax
            exemptions produced budget deficits over many years until
            2006. The state was failing to comply with Brazilian fiscal
            responsibility legislation, and its troubled fiscal
            situation had translated into deteriorated public services,
            and poor economic performance. An International Bank for
            Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) loan was designed to
            support the state government’s effort to turn around the
            fiscal situation in the state. It supported the state with a
            two-tranche development policy loan (DPL). IBRD used its
            supervision resources to provide technical assistance to the
            state, helping the government to achieve the proposed
            results. Its innovative and tailor-made repayment profile
            was key to smoothing the highly volatile debt repayment
            profile of the state, and to secure the approval of, and a
            guarantee, from the federal government. Drawing upon IBRD
            financial and technical support, Rio Grande do Sul
            restructured its debt, generating savings of 379 million
            dollars up to December 2010. The state government was able
            to turn its finances around from a negative operating
            balance to a positive figure of 1,497 million dollars and
            increased investments.

A fiscal turnaround in Brazil’s state of Rio
            Grande do Sul

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Rio Grande Do Sul Fiscal
            Sustainability for Growth Program Development Policy Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Rio Grande Do Sul (RS)
            Fiscal Sustainability for Growth Program Development Policy
            Loan (DPL) Project for Mexico were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was low or
            negligible, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also satisfactory. The lesson
            highlights the importance of the debt restructuring
            operation among the fiscal consolidation measures behind the
            fiscal turnaround in RS. The restructuring not only saved
            budgetary resources, but was also a key to smoothing the
            debt service profile in 2009 and 2010, at a time when the
            global economic crisis increased uncertainty and rollover
            risks worldwide. The improved profile also facilitated the
            task of budget planning. The debt restructuring was thus of
            paramount significance to the state and spurred a new demand
            from sub-national clients willing to engage in fiscal
            consolidation operations with debt restructuring components
            with the Bank. A political economy lesson can also be drawn.
            The loan supported reforms aimed at addressing structural
            fiscal imbalances. However, undertaking such reforms
            requires strong social coalitions. These coalitions in turn
            take a relatively long time to build while the DPL
            instrument is short-lived. In this sense, the DPL merit was
            at least to help build the needed coalition by bringing up
            the issue. The submission of a new draft law on pension
            reform by the new Government is suggestive that this DPL may
            have contributed to building a consensus around this issue.
            Finally, the timing of the loan suited very well the
            state's needs.

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Rio Grande Do Sul Fiscal
            Sustainability for Growth Loan Program

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Fiscal
            Sustainability for Growth Loan Program in Brazil are to
            assist the State of Rio Grande do Sul achieve a more stable
            and sustainable fiscal position, to improve its debt
            profile, to reduce social security imbalances, and to
            enhance the efficiency of the state public sector. This
            Program Document presents a two-tranche Development Policy
            Loan (DPL) in the amount of USN.1 billion to the State of
            Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil. The proceeds of the loan will
            used to restructure part of the state's debts and
            smooth its debt servicing profile. It will provide financial
            support at a critical juncture, as a new administration
            pursues policies to reverse a non-sustainable fiscal
            position. The operation is also a priority for the Federal
            Government, since it will enhance compliance by the state
            with the federal Fiscal Responsibility Law. The program
            supported by this operation is broad based and reflects a
            commitment to a multi-year process of reforms.The actions
            include, among others, a rationalization of expenditures,
            improving tax collection efficiency, limiting the use of tax
            expenditures, improving fiscal and debt management systems,
            restructuring of the state's debt, reforming the social
            security system, modernizing public sector management,
            reorganizing the civil service, and improving the provision
            of public services. The DPL is multi-tranched in order to
            support policy continuity. The disbursement of the first
            tranche would be made on the basis of actions already
            implemented. The second tranche is expected to be disbursed
            following the implementation of policy actions in 2009.
